intro: Equilabium kamerunense, commonly known as the Cameroon labium, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Cameroon. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It is often found growing in moist, shaded areas along riverbanks and in dense undergrowth.
